Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "the "linkassemblies" task failed for Android Xamarin Forms" (#1521) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @ExzaSolutions on December 27, 2017 8:25_

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description

When the Xamarin Forms Project builds the Android build fails.
The android is set to build to Release,and the linking is set to Sdk Assemblies only.
When it is set to None it builds successfully,but the apk is far too big then.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Nuget Packages to Xamarin Forms Solution
2. Set Android Project To Release and linking to Sdk Assemblies only.
3. Build Solution

### Expected Behavior
Should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
Fails with "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly. System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set

### Basic Information

Events.RelatedBody:
_From @borbmizzet on March 27, 2018 22:38_

### Description
My app was crashing intermittently with a "System.ObjectDisposedException".  I have no idea what was causing it, but it seems to have something to do with an IsEnabled Property binding.  I was never able to trigger it while debugging, so all I have is the crash report from Visual Studio app center.  Sorry for the lack of information.
### Steps to Reproduce

Unknown 

### Expected Behavior
Not crashing
### Actual Behavior
Crashing
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
  - Android: 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 26.1.0.1
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms(.Pages) 2.5.0.280555, Acr.UserDialogs 7.0.1
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Note 5

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deploying to Android fails with zipalign error" (#1519) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @johnshardman on April 4, 2018 10:25_

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
After upgrading Visual Studio to 15.6, deployment of app to Android (physical devices and emulators) failed with a zipalign error.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Check the "Generate one package (.apk) per selected ABI" option in the Android project properties.
2. Hit F5

### Expected Behavior

App should build, deploy and run in debug mode.

### Actual Behavior

Deployment error reported:

AndroidZipAlign Task
Alignment: 4
Source: G:\tfs\MyApp\Top\MyApp.Android\obj\Debug\android\bin\com.MyApp.MyApp-arm64-v8a.apk
DestinationDirectory: bin\Debug\
C:\ProgramFiles\Android\AndroidSDK\build-tools\25.0.2\zipalign.exe 4 "G:\tfs\MyApp\Top\MyApp.Android\obj\Debug\android\bin\com.MyApp.MyApp-arm64-v8a.apk" "bin\Debug\com.MyApp.MyApp-arm64-v8a-Signed.apk" 
Output file 'bin\Debug\com.MyApp.MyApp-arm64-v8a-Signed.apk' exists
"zipalign.exe" exited with code 1.
Done executing task "AndroidZipAlign" -- FAILED

### Basic Information

VS 15.6
XF 2.4.0.38779

I'm not the only one seeing this. @batmaci has also reported it at https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/comment/325764

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Forms crash in IOS project do not stop at exception line - do not display full exception trace" (#2242) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: ### Description When I debug an IOS project on a Xamarin Forms solution, when there is exception, the debugger do not stop at exception line the debugger do not display complete exception message exception message exist : I can copy the text on the popup and paste it in text editor. The option in Run, New Exception catch-point + Pause the program + When an exception is thrown are selected. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a Xamarin forms application in the xaml page, add a listview, with image and label. in code behind, load image with RSS feed images run the IOS project on ios device scroll the listview app will crash : see screen shot for code, please do not hesitate to check my github solution note : it is a work in progress, just for me to validate the stability of xamarin tools before working on it on production projects. https://github.com/ormaa/RSS-Reader_IOS-Android ### Expected Behavior The app should stop where the exception occurred the exception popup should display the message and stack trace ### Actual Behavior the app stop in main.cs the popup do not display any message, but a hort part of the message. no stack trace. ### Basic Information Version with issue: visual studio community 7.4.2 build 12 Last known good version: none MACOS High sierra 10.13.3 Xcode 9.3, swift 4.1 I obtain the same error when I run app on IOS simulator, or IOS device iphone 5S IOS 11.3 ### Screenshots ![screen shot 2018-04-04 at 11 01 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8026564/38298735-7bb40dbc-37f8-11e8-8126-e21bb8d2dc3c.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android CreateFragment native forms" (#2256) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
There is a functional difference between IOS and android when it comes to page extensions for native forms.

IOS allows to create a viewcontroller from every Page object: 

public static UIViewController CreateViewController(this Page page)

Android only allows to create a fragment from a ContentPage object

public static Fragment CreateFragment(this ContentPage view, Context context)

I can't seem to find any reason for this, as the code is almost 100% the same apart from this. Is this something that could be changed, or is there a good reason for the difference between the platforms?

On IOS we can create a native form from a NavigationPage while on Android this is impossible.

Confirm that the <UsingTask> declaration is correct, that the assembly and all its dependencies are available, and that the task contains a public class that implements Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask.

I already tried to clean solution `bin` and `obj` directories. I tried to clean .nuget packages cache. I closed and restarted Visual Studio several times.
I tried to install `Microsoft.Bcl.Build` NuGet package, same error.

This is not the first time I got the error while trying to use a pre-release package. I end up with not using them, but it is quite frustrating...

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project Xamarin.Forms with .Net Standard 2.0
2. Update Xamarin.Forms package to any pre-release version from nuget.org
3. Build the solution

### Expected Behavior

Solution should build

### Actual Behavior

100% times the following error
```
1>C:\Users\gra\.nuget\packages\xamarin.forms\3.0.0.296286-pre2\build\netstandard2.0\Xamarin.Forms.targets(35,3): error MSB4062: The "Xamarin.Forms.Build.Tasks.GetTasksAbi" task could not be loaded from the assembly C:\Users\gra\.nuget\packages\xamarin.forms\3.0.0.296286-pre2\build\netstandard2.0\Xamarin.Forms.Build.Tasks.dll. Could not load file or assembly 'netstandard, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=cc7b13ffcd2ddd51' or one of its dependencies. Le fichier spécifié est introuvable. Confirm that the <UsingTask> declaration is correct, that the assembly and all its dependencies are available, and that the task contains a public class that implements Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITask.
```

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: All pre-release packages
- Last known good version: all release packages
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.4

### Reproduction Link

[Reproduction project](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1879336/App2.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[iOS / Android] Cannot focus a custom component" (#2295) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When using a custom component, it is not possible to handle the Focused event

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new cross-platform project (.NET Standard)
2. Create a new custom component with the focused event handled
3. Include it on the MainPage.xaml
3. On the MainPage.xaml.cs, call MyCustomComponent.Focus()

### Expected Behavior
The Focused event is fired

### Actual Behavior
Nothing happens

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 
Xamarin.Forms 2.4.0.91020 => KO
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555 => KO
Xamarin.Forms 2.5.1.44934 => KO

- Last known good version: Unknowm
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.5
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS: 11.9.1.21
  - Android: 8.2.0.16
  - UWP:  Not included in the scope
- Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2
- Nuget Packages: Only those included in the initial project startup
- Affected Devices: iOS, Android at least

### Reproduction Link

[App2.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1881321/App2.zip)

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
The .Design assemblies are targeting .NET 4.7, but if you use Xamarin.Forms in WPF and target an older version (4.5-4.7) you'll get the following warnings:
```
2>------ Build started: Project: FormsTestApp.WPF, Configuration: Debug Any CPU ------
2>C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\Bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(2052,5): warning MSB3274: The primary reference "Xamarin.Forms.Core.Design, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, processorArchitecture=MSIL" could not be resolved because it was built against the ".NETFramework,Version=v4.7" framework. This is a higher version than the currently targeted framework ".NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1".
2>C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Enterprise\MSBuild\15.0\Bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(2052,5): warning MSB3274: The primary reference "Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.Design, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, processorArchitecture=MSIL" could not be resolved because it was built against the ".NETFramework,Version=v4.7" framework. This is a higher version than the currently targeted framework ".NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1".
2>  FormsTestApp.WPF -> c:\apps\dotnet\TestApps\FormsTestApp.WPF\bin\Debug\FormsTestApp.WPF.exe
========== Build: 1 succeeded, 0 failed, 1 up-to-date, 1 skipped ==========
```
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a WPF project targeting 4.6.1
2. Reference `Xamarin.Forms.Platform.WPF.3.0.0.296286-pre2` and the dependencies which only requires 4.5.0
3. Build, and observe the above warnings

### Expected Behavior
No warning is generated.

### Actual Behavior
Build warnings

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.296286-pre2
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS2017 (15.5.2)
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  -net461
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
```xml
    <PackageReference Include="Xamarin.Forms">
      <Version>3.0.0.296286-pre2</Version>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="Xamarin.Forms.Platform.WPF">
      <Version>3.0.0.296286-pre2</Version>
    </PackageReference>
```
- Affected Devices:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[WPF] Modal Page Transperancy doesn't work" (#2188) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Popping a Modal Page from a MasterDetailView isn't transparent even though I'm setting it to transparent in both the NavigationPage, and the ContentPage inside it

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Pop a modal page from MasterDetailView in either NavigationPage or ContentPage

### Expected Behavior
Transparency setting to be honored 

### Actual Behavior
Modal is not transparent

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms.WPF
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
    - WPF
- Affected Devices:
   - Windows Devices

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin Forms crash in IOS project do not stop at exception line - do not display full exception trace" (#3893) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: _From @olivier38070 on April 4, 2018 9:16_ ### Description When I debug an IOS project on a Xamarin Forms solution, when there is exception, the debugger do not stop at exception line the debugger do not display complete exception message exception message exist : I can copy the text on the popup and paste it in text editor. The option in Run, New Exception catch-point + Pause the program + When an exception is thrown are selected. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a Xamarin forms application in the xaml page, add a listview, with image and label. in code behind, load image with RSS feed images run the IOS project on ios device scroll the listview app will crash : see screen shot for code, please do not hesitate to check my github solution note : it is a work in progress, just for me to validate the stability of xamarin tools before working on it on production projects. https://github.com/ormaa/RSS-Reader_IOS-Android ### Expected Behavior The app should stop where the exception occurred the exception popup should display the message and stack trace ### Actual Behavior the app stop in main.cs the popup do not display any message, but a hort part of the message. no stack trace. ### Basic Information Version with issue: visual studio community 7.4.2 build 12 Last known good version: none MACOS High sierra 10.13.3 Xcode 9.3, swift 4.1 I obtain the same error when I run app on IOS simulator, or IOS device iphone 5S IOS 11.3 ### Screenshots ![screen shot 2018-04-04 at 11 01 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8026564/38298735-7bb40dbc-37f8-11e8-8126-e21bb8d2dc3c.png) _Copied from original issue: xamarin/Xamarin.Forms#2242_

Commit list for mono/mono:

* mono/mono@b4e428d7c41 [sdks] Use wget in place of curl, it's installed by default on Linux (#8060)

* mono/mono@00f930c13d8 [SDKS] Fix Android SDK build on Linux (#8022)
* mono/mono@911b32aef07 [runtime] Fix --disable-btls. (#8001)
* mono/mono@82306753f93 [sdks] Fix MXE_PREFIX for XA (#8011)
* mono/mono@edabe884172 [sdb] Add reference counting for single step requests, they can be accessed concurrently by the single step processing code and the event request clearing code. Fixes #7137. (#7973)
* mono/mono@12304ec458c [2017-12] [Facades] Add System.Memory facade to mobile profiles (#7969)
* mono/mono@9340ebefcd6 [2017-12] Disable building btls/ and support/ on the bcl build, they are not needed. (#7959)
* mono/mono@32031273ec1 [2017-12] [sdks] Add provisioning for Android SDK and NDK (#7980)
* mono/mono@083c130d4a4 [System] Disable SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus (#7976)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[backport][msbuild] Skip reference assemblies passed to mtouch (#3791)" (#3889) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- Fixes issue #3199: Could not AOT the assembly System.Runtime.CompilerServices.Unsafe.dll (MT3001)
  (https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3199)
- Test case: https://www.dropbox.com/s/kxt3isgzn74nq35/Issue3199.zip?dl=0


Given a Nuget Package added via the "package reference" mechanism and the said package having netstandard 'lib' **and** 'ref' folders;
MTouch was getting reference assemblies and was trying to AOT them. This resulted in an error as those assemblies are only facades.


'ResolveNuGetPackageAssets' computes the NuGet packages using their json asset file, adds the full assemblies to 'ReferenceCopyLocalPaths' and outputs the resolved references via '_ReferencesFromNuGetPackages'.

This is exactly what "Microsoft.NuGet.Build.Tasks"'s 'ResolveNuGetPackageAssets' target does.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Models are registered using the name of the corresponding protocol" (#3875) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Given the following api description:

```csharp
[Protocol, Model]
[BaseType (typeof(NSObject))]
interface MTLCaptureScope
{
}
```

we generate:

```csharp
[Protocol()]
[Register("MTLCaptureScope", false)]
[Model]
public unsafe abstract partial class MTLCaptureScope : NSObject, IMTLCaptureScope {
}
```

this becomes a problem, because we're effectively declaring an Objective-C type with a name (`MTLCaptureScope`) that might conflict with another platform type.

And that's exactly what happens (https://github.com/mono/monodevelop/issues/4425):

```
objc[88046]: Class MTLCaptureScope is implemented in both /System/Library/Frameworks/Metal.framework/Versions/A/Metal (0x7fff9384e1d0) and /Users/mikayla/code/monodevelop/main/build/bin/MonoDevelop (0x10967c6a0). One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined.
```

This is not a problem unless Apple defines an Objective-C class with the same name as the protocol, but it does sometimes happen.

Another variation of the same problem is if two different binding projects bind the same protocol (issue #3832).

This became worse after 9c2010e44012387803af8bbd460910d28bba0586, because then we started registering these types in the static registrar (previously we wouldn't register types that were also models in the static registrar). This change was implemented to match the dynamic registrar (which did try to register these types, but instead of blindly registering the type, the dynamic registrar would first check if the Objective-C type already existed, and if it did, use the existing Objective-C type. This would obviously have led to quite random and inexplicable behavior if managed code suddenly started wrapping a different Objective-C class than expected (like in the `MTLCaptureScope` case from above)).

Solutions:

1. Change the generator to generate a unique Objective-C name for the model:

```csharp
[Protocol()]
[Register("Xamarin_iOS__MTLCaptureScope", false)]
[Model]
public unsafe abstract partial class MTLCaptureScope : NSObject, IMTLCaptureScope {
}
```

* Con: it would require third-party binding libraries that run into issue #3832 to be rebuilt.

2. Revert 9c2010e44012387803af8bbd460910d28bba0586, and addition fix the dynamic registrar to behave like the static registrar (don't try to register models).

* Con: I'm not even sure this would work (presumably there was a reason models were registered in the first place, but it might just as well have been an oversight too)
* Con: Even if it works in simple cases, it feels like something that might run into unexpected consequences at some point.

> VS bug [#595223](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/595223), VS bug [#595224](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/595224)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[generator] Register models with unique names to not match platform types. Fixes #3875. (#3879)" (#3888) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
* Move Registrar.SanitizeName to StringUtils.SanitizeObjectiveCName.

* [generator] Register models with unique names to not match platform types. Fixes #3875.

* [NSObject] Don't compare against a non-existent protocol.

* [generator] Make it possible to register models like before if the binding developer wishes it.

* [src] Make sure to not declare ObjC classes Apple already defines.
